an7.62:4.2: For ‘good deeds’ is a term for happiness.
an7.62:4.3: I recall undergoing for a long time the likable, desirable, and agreeable results of good deeds performed over a long time.
an7.62:4.4: I developed a mind of love for seven years.
an7.62:4.5: As a result, for seven eons of the world contracting and evolving I didn’t return to this world again.
an7.62:4.6: As the world contracted I went to the realm of streaming radiance. As it evolved I was reborn in an empty mansion of Brahmā.
an7.62:5.1: There I was Brahmā, the Great Brahmā, the undefeated, the champion, the universal seer, the wielder of power.
an7.62:5.2: I was Sakka the Lord of Gods thirty-six times.
an7.62:5.3: Many hundreds of times I was a king, a wheel-turning monarch, a just and principled king. My dominion extended to all four sides, I achieved stability in the country, and I possessed the seven treasures.
an7.62:5.5: the wheel, the elephant, the horse, the jewel, the woman, the treasurer, and the adviser as the seventh treasure.
an7.62:5.6: I had over a thousand sons who were valiant and heroic, crushing the armies of my enemies.
an7.62:5.7: After conquering this land girt by sea, I reigned by principle, without rod or sword.”
an7.62:6.2: of wholesome deeds, for one seeking happiness.
